data.title: Claude Simon won the Nobel Prize in 1985 and is considered one of the core writers of the nouveau roman movement. The Flanders Road, his...
data.meta_description: 628 likes, 6 comments - nyrbooks on July 12, 2022: "Claude Simon won the Nobel Prize in 1985 and is considered one of the core writers of the nouveau roman movement. The Flanders Road, his best and most famous novel, is about the death of a French cavalry officer in WWII and the trauma that radiates from it, told from the perspective of a distant relative and soldier under him. If you’re a Proust fan, this is a novel for you. Plus it’s translated by the late, great Richard Howard.".
